intro: Microstylis retusa var. brevis, commonly known as the short-styled rush, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly curved, contributing to its overall herbaceous appearance. Microstylis retusa var. brevis plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
